page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF THE AREA
page.content: TO THE NORTH IS THE RIDGE OF HIGH GROUND ON WHICH THE{OLD MINING TOWN}OF {TYLDESLEY}STANDS. TO THE SOUTH THE LAND SLOPES DOWN TO THE{BRIDGEWATER {CANAL.}PASSING THROUGH THE AREA EAST TO WEST ARE:{EAST LANCASHIRE ROAD {(A580), MANCHESTER ROAD ASTLEY (A572), {MANCHESTER ROAD TYLDESLEY (A577),}THE LINE OF THE{LEIGH-MANCHESTER RAILWAY (NOW A LANDSCAPED PATHWAY) AND THE {CANAL.}THE AREA CONTAINS FOUR OLD {VILLAGE CENTRES (ASTLEY, GIN PIT, {MOSLEY COMMON AND ASTLEY GREEN)}NOW ALMOST FORMING ONE URBAN DEVELOPMENT. {FARMING}IS STILL WIDESPREAD IN THE AREA DESPITE THE GROWTH OF NEW HOUSING. THERE ARE MANY SMALL {INDUSTRIAL UNITS}THROUGHOUT THE AREA WHICH PROVIDE{LOCAL EMPLOYMENT ALTHOUGH MANY PEOPLE IN THE AREA TRAVEL OUT OF THE AREA TO WORK ESPECIALLY TO {MANCHESTER.}
